detaileddescription.para: Audio routing node: primary audio output
Control routing node: Attack (ms) - attack rate of the synth in milliseconds

Control routing node: Frequency ratio - Ratio of synthesized frequency to note playing. For example, a value of 1.0 would play the same note. A value of 0.5 would play a note an octave below. A value of 2.0 would play a note an octave above.
Control routing node: Frequency ratio of fm modulator - Ratio of fm modulator frequency to synth frequency. A value of 1.0 would do fm mod at same frequency as note being synthesized.
Control routing node: Frequency mod depth

Control routing node: Filter resonance - The resonance of the filter applied each synth voice. A value of 1.0 is no resonance, value higher than 1.0 increases resonance. Values below 1.0 (but higher than 0.0) further smooth out the filter.
Control routing node: Filter response - How far the filter sweeps with each played note

memberdef.argsstring: (OSC_TYPES osc_type, float attack_ms, float filter_resonance, float filter_response)
memberdef.name: fx_instrument_synth

briefdescription.para: Constructs a new instance of the instrument synth (basic constructor)

parameterdescription.para: The type of oscillator
The attack milliseconds
The filter resonance (1.0 is normal, > 1 increases resonance)
How much the filter sweeps (0.0 to 1.0)

memberdef.argsstring: (OSC_TYPES osc_type, OSC_TYPES fm_mod_osc_type, float fm_mod_depth, float freq_ratio, float freq_ratio_fm_mod, float attack_ms, float filter_resonance, float filter_response)
memberdef.name: fx_instrument_synth

briefdescription.para: Constructs a new instance of the instrument synth (advanced constructor)

parameterdescription.para: The type of oscillator
The type of oscillator used for fm synthesis
The depth of the fm synthesis (0.0 to 1.0)
The frequency ratio of played note to synth note (e.g. 1.0 is same, 0.5 is octave down, 2.0 is octave up)
The frequency ratio of the fm modulation to synthesized note
The attack milliseconds
The filter resonance (1.0 is normal, > 1 increases resonance)
How much the filter sweeps

briefdescription.para: Enable the instrument synth (it is enabled by default)
Bypass the instrument synth (will just pass zero audio through)
Sets the frequency ratio of the synth.

parameterdescription.para: Ratio of synthesized frequency to note playing. For example, a value of 1.0 would play the same note. A value of 0.5 would play a note an octave below. A value of 2.0 would play a note an octave above.
The fm modifier ratio relative to the frequency of the tone being played
The FM mod depth (0.0 -> 1.0)
The attack milliseconds
The resonance of the filter
The response (0.0 is not responsive / static filter, 1.0 is very dynamic filter)

briefdescription.para: Sets the the type of oscillator used as the primary synth.

parameterdescription.para: The new type of LFO (OSC_TYPES)

briefdescription.para: Sets the the type of oscillator used as the primary synth.

parameterdescription.para: The new type of LFO (OSC_TYPES)

briefdescription.para: Prints the parameters for the instrument synth.

detaileddescription.para: The instrument synth is capable of reading polyphonic notes from a stringed instrument and playing synth notes in their place.
The instrument synth does not have an input. It is hard-wired into the instrument in jack of the pedal.
